subject: AI
title: Tree of Thought
description: Explore branching reasoning paths for complex problems.

hook.text: Chain of thought is a straight line. But some problems need exploration ‚Äî what if the first reasoning step leads to a dead end?

buildup.text: Tree of Thought (ToT) lets the model generate multiple possible next steps at each stage, evaluate which ones look promising, and backtrack from dead ends.

discovery.text: On planning puzzles ‚Äî like the 'Game of 24' where you combine four numbers to make 24 ‚Äî ToT solved problems that flat chain-of-thought couldn't touch.

twist.text: ToT is expensive and complex to implement. You need multiple LLM calls per step, an evaluation mechanism, and backtracking logic. It's rarely worth it for simple tasks.

climax.text: Use ToT for problems with combinatorial search: puzzle solving, multi-step planning, or creative brainstorming where the first idea isn't always the best.

punchline.text: When one path isn't enough, let the model explore a forest of possibilities.

quiz.question: How does Tree of Thought differ from Chain of Thought?
options: It explores branching reasoning paths instead of a single linear chain
It doesn't require a language model
It only works for math problems
